intro: Alpinia eustales, commonly known as the orchid of the Andes, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy, fragrant flowers that come in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a slightly waxy texture. Alpinia eustales is typically grown as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and unique appearance.
